https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/59014/ : SUCCESS
Change has been successfully merged
Maybe just say for future re-use. Let us not reference changes that are a part of a future commit.
Ack
too much changes , I am not comfortable to change the flow for a service pack.

As discussed earlier, this commit has vpd-tool api restructuring(api specific to system VPD processing), to avoid redundant code.
Thus can make use of these apis for both options, --fixSystemVPD and system VPD --mfgClean.

I don't think this is a good idea to call exit from a function that is in a utility file. Please throw an exception that can be properly handled. That makes me think if this function should even be defined here in this file?
I agree. Modified it by throwing run time error.
Surely there is type alias for this?
nope, there is no existing type alias for this structure
This can be a constexpr
cannot make it constexpr as am overwriting the variable as needed in this for loop.
It is already under openpower::vpd::
Ack

This is a duplicate code from ibm_vpd_app.cpp

Please remove this code from ibm_vpd_app.cpp and make use of this api there as well.

in ibm_vpd_app.cpp, vpdVector parsing is not done immediately after parsing json.
there are so many code in between(like system vpd file check,skip recollection, chassis status check). In case if I use this api at this line https://github.com/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/blob/master/ibm_vpd_app.cpp#L1468 
then we will be processing json twice.

True, agree, the point is why are you parsing the JSON in this function? Why can't you do all the JSON processing before calling this API?
Also, an API called "getVPDInMap" should only get VPD in map and this way you can also reuse the code.

ALso please make sure if you are calling Json parse then you are handling exception thrown by parsing failure.

The purpose here is to handle code redundancy, so lets keep getVPDInMap() impl as it is. Will handle json failure exceptions as needed.
And I don't want to touch the code in ibm_vpd_app, as it doesn't fit to use this api.

> And I don't want to touch the code in ibm_vpd_app, as it doesn't fit to use this api.
How it does not fit? It is duplicate code. We can't keep of pushing duplicate code.
keep on*
ok. I'll handle this case by spilting this into two util apis, jsonParse() and vpdIntoMap(). and will handle the redundancy in ibm_vpd_app too.
Please make use of these defined types. It will make code more readable.
Done
propertyMap
GetAll returns std::vector<std::pair<>> and not std::vector<std::map>>. Cannot use PropertyMap.
RecordName
Done
Why this change we required?
we need to refresh the mismatch variable for every keyword(under a record) and not just for every record.
Handle parse exception?
Done
